content.user_title: Verify Code Quality with Truth Scoring
content.value_statement: Agents and automated systems can produce low-quality or unreliable outputs that slip through review. The verification quality assurance skill provides real-time truth scoring, automated code verification checks, and automatic rollback for failed verifications to ensure only high-quality code enters your codebase.
actual_capabilities: Calculate real-time truth scores (0.0-1.0 scale) for code, agents, and tasks
Run automated verification checks for code correctness, security, and best practices
Automatically rollback changes that fall below configurable accuracy thresholds
Generate verification reports in JSON, HTML, CSV, and markdown formats
Integrate with CI/CD pipelines through exit codes and structured output
Monitor quality trends over time with statistical analysis and confidence intervals
limitations: Requires claude-flow CLI tool to be installed separately
Rollback features depend on Git integration for version control
Dashboard and real-time monitoring require Node.js 18+
Does not perform actual code execution or testing, only static analysis

use_cases.title: Ensure High-Quality Agent Outputs
use_cases.description: Set truth score thresholds to automatically reject agent-generated code that falls below quality standards. Configure auto-rollback to revert failed verifications and maintain codebase integrity.

use_cases.title: CI/CD Quality Gate
use_cases.description: Integrate verification checks into GitHub Actions or GitLab CI pipelines. Use JSON output and exit codes to pass or fail builds based on configurable quality thresholds.

use_cases.title: Track Code Quality Trends
use_cases.description: Monitor truth scores over time to identify quality regressions. Export metrics to monitoring systems like DataDog or Prometheus for long-term trend analysis.

prompt_templates.title: Quick Verification Check
prompt_templates.prompt: Run a verification check on my current code. Use the default threshold of 0.95. Show me the overall truth score and which checks passed or failed.

prompt_templates.title: Custom Threshold Verification
prompt_templates.prompt: Verify the code in src/ with a stricter threshold of 0.99. Include verbose output explaining any failures. Enable auto-fix for minor issues.
prompt_templates.scenario: High-stakes code review requiring strict quality

prompt_templates.title: CI/CD Integration
prompt_templates.prompt: Run verification check in JSON format and output to verification.json. Check if the overall score meets the 0.95 threshold. Exit with code 0 if passing, 1 if failing.

prompt_templates.title: Quality Trend Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me the truth scores for the past 7 days. Include trends, standard deviation, and confidence intervals. Identify any agents or tasks with declining quality.

output_examples.input: Run verification check on src/app.js with default threshold
Check truth scores for the past 24 hours
Run verification with auto-rollback on failure
output: Rolling back to last good commit: abc123

best_practices: Set appropriate thresholds per environment: 0.99 for production, 0.95 for staging, 0.90 for development
Integrate verification into pre-commit hooks to catch quality issues before they enter version control
Review rollback history regularly to understand which changes fail verification and why
anti_patterns: Using the same threshold for all code regardless of criticality
Ignoring declining truth score trends until they cause verification failures
Disabling auto-rollback without having manual review processes in place

faq.question: What truth score threshold should I use?
faq.answer: Use 0.99 for production code and critical systems. Use 0.95 for standard development work. Use 0.90 for experimental features or prototypes. Adjust based on your quality requirements.

faq.question: Does verification run actual tests?
faq.answer: No. Verification performs static analysis including syntax validation, security scanning, best practices checks, and complexity analysis. It does not execute code or run test suites.

faq.question: How does auto-rollback work?
faq.answer: When verification fails, auto-rollback uses Git to revert changes to the last known good state. It creates a backup first, then resets to the specified commit. Works with both full and selective rollbacks.

faq.question: Can I verify multiple files at once?
faq.answer: Yes. Use the batch verification command with pattern matching like npx claude-flow@alpha verify batch --pattern 'src/**/*.ts'. Supports parallel processing for faster verification.

faq.question: What CI/CD systems are supported?
faq.answer: Any CI/CD system that can run Node.js commands. The skill includes examples for GitHub Actions and GitLab CI. Works with Jenkins, CircleCI, and others through standard command execution.

faq.question: How are truth scores calculated?
faq.answer: Truth scores combine multiple factors: code correctness, security posture, adherence to best practices, performance characteristics, and documentation quality. Each factor is weighted and scored independently.
